what: Convenient Access to Python Wheel Packages Prepared for Windows
title: Convenient Access to Python Wheel Packages Prepared for Windows
text: Downloads pre-compiled Windows ‘wheel’ files (.whl) Python geospatial packages https://github.com/cgohlke/geospatial-wheels. unofficial binary installers Python geospatial libraries Windows prepared Christoph Gohlke. Wheels various packages, Python versions, architectures made available via GitHub releases, providing ability revert prior versions needed.

title: Convenient Access to Python Wheel Packages Prepared for Windows
Convenient Access to Python Wheel Packages Prepared for Windows
text: basic example shows solve common problem:
code: library(rgeowheels) #> rgeowheels 0.0.4 #> Latest cached release: 2023-11-03 #>  <https://github.com/cgohlke/geospatial-wheels/releases/tag/v2023.11.3>  if (Sys.info()["sysname"] == "Windows")   install_wheel("GDAL")  install_wheel("rasterio", pyversion = "3.8", url_only = TRUE) #> [1] "https://github.com/cgohlke/geospatial-wheels/releases/download/v2023.1.10.1/rasterio-1.3.4-cp38-cp38-win_amd64.whl"

what: Install Python Wheels From 'geospatial-wheels' Repository — install_wheel
title: Install Python Wheels From 'geospatial-wheels' Repository — install_wheel
text: Used download install latest versions wheels available https://github.com/cgohlke/geospatial-wheels.

title: Install Python Wheels From 'geospatial-wheels' Repository — install_wheel
code: install_wheel(   package,   version = "latest",   pyversion = "latest",   architecture = "win_amd64",   python = get_rgeowheels_python(),   destdir = tempdir(),   url_only = FALSE,   download_only = FALSE )

title: Install Python Wheels From 'geospatial-wheels' Repository — install_wheel
text: package Python package name install. e.g. "rasterio" version Python package version install. Default "latest" determines latest version available asset list (considers pyversion set). pyversion Python version install package . Default "latest" determines latest version available asset list. architecture Python package version install. Default "win_amd64", alternatives include "win_arm64" "win32". python Path Python executable use install. Default: get_rgeowheels_python() destdir Destination directory downloaded wheel file. Default: tempdir() url_only Return URL .whl file without downloading? Default: FALSE download_only Download .whl file without attempting install? Default: FALSE

title: Install Python Wheels From 'geospatial-wheels' Repository — install_wheel
text: Called side effects (download install Python wheel). Returns character containing path .whl file url_only=TRUE download_only=TRUE.

title: List assets available from
text: release Specify custom release list assets . Default: NULL update_cache Force update wheel download index? Default: FALSE

title: List assets available from
text: data.frame containing  package, version, pyversion, architecture metadata asset release.

what: rgeowheels: Convenient Access to 'Python' 'Wheel' Packages Prepared for 'Windows' — rgeowheels-package
title: rgeowheels: Convenient Access to 'Python' 'Wheel' Packages Prepared for 'Windows' — rgeowheels-package
text: Downloads pre-compiled 'Windows' 'wheel' files (.whl) 'Python' geospatial packages https://github.com/cgohlke/geospatial-wheels. unofficial binary installers geospatial libraries prepared Christoph Gohlke. Wheels various packages, 'Python' versions, architectures made available via 'GitHub' releases, providing ability revert prior versions needed.

what: Get or Set Python Path — set_rgeowheels_python
title: Get or Set Python Path — set_rgeowheels_python
text: Set path Python binary used run installation commands. May system virtual/conda environment.

title: Get or Set Python Path — set_rgeowheels_python
Get or Set Python Path — set_rgeowheels_python
Get or Set Python Path — set_rgeowheels_python
text: character Value option "rgeowheels.python", , set, value system environment variable "R_RGEOWHEELS_PYTHON". neither set, result Sys.("python") (Sys.("python3") former fails).
